paper_abstract: This special issue on Security in Reconfigurable Systems Design reports on recent research results in the design and implementation of trustworthy reconfigurable systems. Five articles cover topics including power-efficient implementation of public-key cryptography, side-channel analysis of electromagnetic radiation, side-channel resistant design, design of robust unclonable functions on an FPGA, and Trojan detection in an FPGA bitstream.
paper_title: Guest Editors' Introduction to Security in Reconfigurable Systems Design
